instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.PM_SLP_S4: What is PM_SLP_S4? This is a typo of PM_SLP_S4_L When you see PM_SLP_S4, assume they meant to type PM_SLP_S4_L.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF: What is SMC_ONOFF? SMC_ONOFF is a signal that tells the machine that the power button has been pressed so it knows to turn on, or turn off. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a, shut down by itself after 20 sec
threads.message:
Hi, This is liquied damaged and some one has cleaned before. There is no visible corrosion or damaged as  I cheked with microscope. board is pretty clean. cheked only with  dc in board and fan same out come.
All the power rails present accurately then after 20 sec missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4</SIGNAL>. <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0</SIGNAL> 12.1 ohms resistance to ground. smc reset works. doesnt respond to pram reset when it boots. takes 12 secnds to get the chime . <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>/<CHIP>U6100</CHIP> pretty clean and voltages are accurate. greatly appriciate your help.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a, shut down by itself after 20 sec
threads.message: Disconnected keyboard? Check <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL>, it may be getting pulled down.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a, shut down by itself after 20 sec
threads.message: Hi Duke, Thanks for the  quick reply.nothing connected other than DC in board. <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> stable 3.4v even after fan stoped.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a, shut down by itself after 20 sec
threads.message: Does the board boot, is there an image?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a, shut down by itself after 20 sec
threads.message: Hi Duke, Yes it is boots after  12 sec fan spinging I get the chime and apple logo. then auto turn off . now nothing connected other tha dc jack as soon connect the magsafe fan spins then after 20 sec auto  turn off

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a, shut down by itself after 20 sec
threads.message: Could be anything really, possibly crap under the SMC? Can you turn it back on by shorting <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>/6?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a, shut down by itself after 20 sec
threads.message: yes I can turn it on back shorting <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR> or 16

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a, shut down by itself after 20 sec
threads.message: Smc  you recon I should replace the smc and check?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a, shut down by itself after 20 sec
threads.message: First try a reflow of the SMC. Inspect board closely for other corrosion too.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a, shut down by itself after 20 sec
threads.message: Hi Duke. SMC Replaced. and thanks to you it is  working again smoothly . Thanks lot for your guidance  Duke.
